greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Numerators of the partial sums of the reciprocals of the numbers (k + 1)*(5*k + 3) = A147874(k+2), for k >= 0.
comment: The corresponding denominators are given in A294829.

For the general case V(m,r;n) = Sum_{k=0..n} 1/((k + 1)*(m*k + r)) = (1/(m - r))*Sum_{k=0..n} (m/(m*k + r) - 1/(k+1)), for r = 1, ..., m-1 and m = 2, 3, ..., and their limits see a comment in A294512. Here [m,r] = [5,3].

The limit of the series is V(5,3) = lim_{n -> oo} V(5,3;n) = ((5/2)*log(5) - (2*phi-1)*(log(phi) + (Pi/5)*sqrt(7-4*phi)))/4, with the golden section phi:= (1 + sqrt(5))/2 = A001622. The value is 0.48170177449... given in A294830.
reference: Max Koecher, Klassische elementare Analysis, Birkhäuser, Basel, Boston, 1987, Eulersche Reihen, pp. 189 - 193.
link: Robert Israel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..891
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Digamma Function
formula: a(n) = numerator(V(5,3;n)) with V(5,3;n) = Sum_{k=0..n} 1/((k + 1)*(5*k + 3)) = Sum_{k=0..n} 1/A147874(k+2) = (1/2)*Sum_{k=0..n} (1/(k + 3/5) - 1/(k+1)) = (-Psi(3/5) + Psi(n+8/5) - (gamma + Psi(n+2)))/2 with the digamma function Psi and the Euler-Mascheroni constant gamma = -Psi(1) from A001620.
example: V(5,3;10^6) = 0.4817015746 to be compared with 0.4817017745 from A294830 with 10 digits.
results.author: _Wolfdieter Lang_, Nov 16 2017
